Container.Name: udp-broadcast-relay-redux
Container.Overview:
UDP Broadcast Relay for IoT Device Discovery in Multi-VLAN Networks
This container relays UDP broadcasts between VLANs to enable IoT device discovery across network segments. Perfect for HDHomerun tuners, Roku devices, Kasa smart home products, and other IoT devices that rely on UDP broadcasts for discovery.
Each container broadcasts to ALL configured VLANs. For selective discovery, run separate containers with different VLAN configurations.
**Use Cases:** - HDHomerun tuner discovery (port 65001) - Roku device discovery (port 1900, SSDP multicast) - Kasa smart plugs/switches (ports 9999/20002) - Other IoT devices requiring UDP broadcast relay
**Network Requirements:** - Host network mode required for multi-VLAN access - NET_ADMIN and NET_RAW capabilities required - Unique RELAY_ID for each container instance

Config.Name: RELAY_ID
Config.Description: Unique ID (1-99) for loop prevention. Must be unique across all relay containers.

Config.Name: INTERFACES
Config.Description: Comma-separated VLAN interfaces (e.g., br0.10,br0.20). Broadcasts go to ALL listed interfaces.

Config.Name: MULTICAST_GROUP
Config.Description: Optional: Multicast IP to join (e.g., 239.255.255.250 for SSDP). Leave empty for broadcast-only operation.

Config.Name: SPOOF_SOURCE
Config.Description: Optional: Override source IP (empty=preserve original, 1.1.1.1=use interface address). Leave empty for most use cases.

Config.Name: TARGET_OVERRIDE
Config.Description: Optional: Override destination IP (empty=preserve original, 255.255.255.255=broadcast). Leave empty for most use cases.
